review_blob: 30 apr 2016, bottle. Brown. Nose is sweet bread. Med body and mildly fizzy. Sweet malty bread, grape jelly, sweet candy. Interesting. Not great.

30 apr 2016, tap. Dirty orange and a bit hazy. Nose is spicy orange rind and mildly sweet. Ned body and mildly fizzy. Orange juice, some grassy hops, mildly sweet, noticeable alcohol. Honestly, it feels a bit flat and heavy. Its kind of on the line between a Belgian strong ale and a DIPA. Still, fairly decent.

29 Apr 2016, tap at Bottle Logic. light gold, clear, no bubbles. nose is pine and faintly dank hops. med/thin body and mildly fizzy. sweet, some granola malt, orange juice citrus, sweet, mildly bitter. Great! my favorite recursion to date.
29 Apr 2016, tap at Bottle Logic. Yellow, clear, no bubbles. nose is lightly sweet with tropical fruit. thin body and moderately fizzy. nice, crisp, lightly bitter, some tropical fruit. great.

29 Apr 2016, tap at the Bruery. yellow, clear, steady bubbles. nose is lots of fresh peaches. thin body and mildly fizzy. mildly tart, hints of peach, a bit dry. ive never had a passion fruit but this tastes a lot like tart peaches. very good.

28 sept 2016, tap at the Bruery. Scarlet. Nose is faintly tart, mildly sweet blueberries. Thin body, dry, barely fizzy. I kind of like this. The blueberries arent pronounced but they mute the Flemish red sufficiently so there isnt much balsamic. Vanilla comes out a bit in the finish. Fun.
beer_name: Bruery Terreux Oude Tart - Blueberry Creme

review_blob: 28 sept 2016, tap at the Bruery. Light gold, no bubbles. Nose is odd. It is cinnamon, rice, and maybe even raisins. There is also a bit of perfume or candy and alcohol. I like it one minute and think its odd the next. Ned body and mildly fizzy. I think the weird thing is the lactose. It tastes just like rice pudding, but the creamy lactose almost doesnt fit the beer. Still, fun taster.
28 Apr 2016, tap at Bruery. Light yellow, clear, no bubbles. Nose is dank and lightly sweet. Thin body and moderately fizzy. Dank, bitter grass, some lemon rind, bitter finish. Decent.

28 Apr 2016, tap at Bruery. Brown. Nose is pine and chocolate malt. Actually not the best combination in my opinion. Thin body and moderately fizzy. Pine hops and some burnt malt, bitter finish. Hops overshadow dark malt. Decent.

28 Apr 2016, tap at Bruery. Yellow, clear, steady bubbles. Nose is mildly sweet, nose is a bitter lemon rind and a bit dank. Thin body and mildly fizzy. Really not much rye here. Actually, I think it is lemon rind up front but the finish is rye. Pretty good.

27 apr 2016, bottle. Dark brown. When cold I actually get some sriracha on the nose, in addition to nutty, faintly sweet, alcohol. Even as it warms up I still get hints of sriracha. Maybe alcohol soaked raisins. Med body and mildly fizzy. Very meaty, moderately woody, bitter wood, mildly sweet, some tobacco notes in the finish. This is a nice beer. It isnt special but its certainly impressive and interesting in places.
beer_name: Central City Thors Hammer Barley Wine - Bourbon Barrel Aged

review_blob: 26 Apr 2016, tap at The Bruery. Black. nose is serious burnt malt followed by serious maple syrup. med/full body and moderately fizzy. this is outstanding! maple syrup comes out much more in the flavor. its like good, syrup covered pancakes. occasionally the burnt malt lingers through the syrup. very good!

26 Apr 2016, tap at The Bruery. gold. nose is sweet granola, dank hops, mild alcohol. thin body and moderately fizzy. very bitter, dank hops, tree bark, very bitter finish. some alcohol, faintly sweet. primarily bitter. nice.

26 Apr 2016, tap at The Bruery. gold. nose is sweet golden belgian ale with crisp dry, grassy hops. med/thin body and moderately fizzy. very dry, grassy hops, bitter in the middle and finish. bitterness overshadows the pleasant belgian ale. nice.
beer_name: The Bruery Cultivar Belgian Pale Ale

review_blob: 25 Apr 2016, can. brown/ruby. nose is coffee with cream, mostly dark roast but slightly sweet. Thin body and moderately fizzy. lots of burnt malt, mild dark coffee. nose is much more creamy cappuccino than actually comes out in the taste. Ok.
24 Apr 2016, bottle. yellow. nose is sweet, floral, perfume, mildly tart. thin body and moderately fizzy. lightly earthy, crisply tart, mildly sweet. nice.

23 Apr 2016, tap at Valiant. light gold, clear, no bubbles. nose is definitely ginger and oranges. more ginger than oranges. thin body and mildly fizzy. sweet, ginger and orange rind. i like this the best of all the third anniversary beers. the ginger and orange overshadow the pepper in the belgian ale. nice flavor. really nice.
beer_name: Valiant III (Third Anniversary Beer) - Step 1 w/ Oranges & Ginger

review_blob: 23 Apr 2016, tap at Valiant. black. nose is sweet, dark chocolate, i might actually be able to smell marshmallow. med/full body and mildly fizzy. sweet, burnt malt, dark chocolate, brown sugar, sweet marshmallow, black coffee in the finish. wow! this is amazing!
23 Apr 2016, tap at Valiant. Brown and faintly cloudy. nose is sweet, lots of bourbon and wood. thin body and moderately fizzy. nutty, sweet, some alcohol bite. lots of wet wood. very boozy. great!

23 Apr 2016, tap at Valiant. gold and a tad hazy. nose is sweet and yeasty. no oak i can smell. med body and moderately fizzy. sweet, belgian strong ale yeast, sweet golden syrup. probably the sweetest of all the various parts. nice.
23 Apr 2016, tap at Valiant. dark brown. nose is acidic brown ale. med/thin body and moderately fizzy. sweet coconut up front, some dark brown malt in the middle, and lingering coconut. great.

23 Apr 2016, tap at Valiant. dark brown/black. nose is mostly chocolate. med/full body and mildly fizzy. Lots of dark chocolate with hints of strawberry. really nice! crazy how much it tastes like neapolitan ice cream.
beer_name: Valiant Not Your Daughters Ice Cream

review_blob: 23 Apr 2016, tap at Valiant. gold. nose is big, sweet, belgian strong ale. donut smell any elderberries. thin body and moderately fizzy. sweet golden syrup. still cant taste ant elderberries.

23 Apr 2016, tap at Valiant. bright gold. nose is exactly like a bag of peach ring candy. thin body and moderately fizzy. moderately tart, lightly sweet, very peach. as taste lingers is tastes a bit creamy and that isnt really pleasant. okay. certainly only a novelty.

23 Apr 2016, tap at Valiant. gold, clear, no bubbles. nose is sweet belgian ale yeast, green pepper, alcohol. med body and mildly fizzy. sweet golden syrup, hints of pepper, noticeable alcohol. nice. Earlier Rating: 4/23/2016 Total Score: 3.423 Apr 2016, tap at Valiant. gold, clear, no bubbles. nose is sweet belgian ale yeast, green pepper, alcohol. med body and mildly fizzy. sweet golden syrup, hints of pepper, noticeable alcohol. nice.
22 apr 2016, tap at Valiant. Orange/Amber. Nose is lots of sour, some raspberry. Thin body and mildly fizzy. Sweet, mild raspberry, only lightly tart. Nice.

22 apr 2016, tap at Valiant. Gold. Nose is heavy on the jalapeo salsa. Med/thin body and moderately fizzy. Doesnt taste hot at all. It is still a mango jalapeo Faldo but the mango comes out more and the jalapeo isnt hot. Still not great but at least interesting.

22 apr 2016, tap at Valiant. Murky/milky light gold. Nose is amazing! It is pins colada! Thin body and moderately fizzy. Wow! Pins colada with some bitter hops in the finish but nothing ever overpowered te pins colada. Awesome!
22 apr 2016, tap at Valiant. Light gold, clear, no bubbles. Nose is dank. Thin body and mildly fizzy. Lightly dank, sweet, orange candy, hints of alcohol, rock candy. Nice.
22 apr 2016, tap at Valiant. Orange. Nose is sweet, balsamic, orange rind. Thin body and mildly fizzy. Orange, woody, mildly sour. Only ok.
22 apr 2016, tap at Valiant. Black. Nose is big burnt chocolate. Ned body and mildly fizzy. Sweet, burnt, dark malt but not too burnt or bitter. Nice!
22 apr 2016, tap at Valiant. Golden Amber. Nose is sweet, spiced, some banana. Med body and mildly fizzy. Sweet, spiced, some pepper, some wood, maybe some blue fruit. Lots of alcohol.

21 Apr 2016, tap at Valiant third anniversary. murky purple. nose is belgian ale with blackberry. med body and mildly fizzy. sweet, blackberries, belgian strong ale, peppers. i would probably prefer the blackberries if it didnt have the typical green pepper flavor of a belgian ale, but it is nice.
21 Apr 2016, tap at Valiant third anniversary. dirty gold. nose is sweet, peppers, golden ale. med body and mildly fizzy. sweet, alcohol, peppers, yeast. actually very nice.

21 Apr 2016, tap at Valiant third anniversary. dark brown with purple tint. nose is strong wood (cider!), alcohol, some nail polish, raisins, sweet. med/full body and mildly fizzy. sweet, nail polish, astringent wood, tobacco, alcohol, cherries. wow! its a bit young/harsh but its still delicious.
21 Apr 2016, tap at Valiant third anniversary. ruby. nose is slightly meaty, a hint earthy or maybe smoky. med body and mildly fizzy. sweet, malty, maybe peaty, raisins. nice.

21 Apr 2016, tap at Valiant third anniversary. very milky yellow. really looks yeasty. nose is astringent and yeasty. i dont think this is ready. med body and mildly fizzy. mildly harsh, champaign yeast almost. actually smells like a washback. this isnt finished fermenting.
19 Apr 2016, can. yellow, clear, occasional bubbles. nose is orange and grapefruit citrus. med body and mildly fizzy. orange rind, slightly sweet, mildl bitterness. I like it!
beer_name: Surly Overrated West Coast Style IPA

review_blob: 18 Apr 2016, can. yellow, clear, steady bubbles, some fine sediment. nose is beautiful grapefruit and some pine needles. med body and mildly fizzy. grassy, grapefruit, hints of peach, bitter throughout but not harsh like Surly Furious. Nice!

15 apr 2016, tap at bottle logic. Gold, clear, no bubbles. Nose is orange and pine. Med body and moderately fizzy. Peaches and grapefruit. Gets more bitter the more you drink, with the nice peach and orange overpowered with pine bitterness. Nice.
15 apr 2016, tap at bottle logic. Pink. Nose is lemonade and pink fruit. Thin body and moderately fizzy. Lightly tart, raspberries, some dry lemonade. Nice.
13 apr 2016, bottle. Faintly dirty yellow with steady bubbles. Nose is light lemon, banana, yeast. Thin/med body and mildly fizzy. Some green pepper, sweet, banana, light lemon, yeast. Decent.
12 apr 2016, bottle. Black. Nose is acidic, fruity cherry, dark chocolate. Thin/med body and moderately fizzy. Faint burnt meat, dark chocolate, dark bread. Pretty good.

12 Apr 2016, bottle. Dark Amber, clear some steady bubbles. Nose is sweet, caramel syrup. Ned/thin body and moderately fizzy. Sweet, caramel, cherries, sticky sweet. Actually not as bad as I expected. Certainly a sweet Vienna lager but still rather nice.
12 apr 2016, tap at Eagle Rock. Dark orange. Nose is orange rind, sweet, bitter. Med body and moderately fizzy. Orange rind, some stale glass, mildly sweet, mildly bitter. Nice.
11 Sept 2016, can. dark amber, clear, steady bubbles. nose is sweet, toasted caramel, some bitter/harsh hop bite. med/thin body and mildly fizzy. toasted malt, astringent bitterness. decent.

10 Apr 2016, bottle. ruby/brown, clear, some steady bubbles. nose is sweet, ready, lightly toasted malt. med body and mildly fizzy. sweet, notes of raisin, hints of burnt toast, some grassy notes. ok.
beer_name: Flying Dog Lucky SOB Irish Red

review_blob: 9 sept 2016, tap at Golden Road. Walnut. Nose is sweet, some pink grapefruit juice, some pine, hints of maybe vanilla bean. Ned body and mildly fizzy. Orange peel, maybe some rye, pine, rather bitter. Nice.
8 Apr 2016, bottle. gold/apricot. nose is grassy hops and faintly tart apricot. med body and mildly fizzy. lightly bitter grassy hops with some faint apricot. decent.

7 Apr 2016, tap at the Bruery. Gold, faintly hazy. Nose is sweet alcohol, triple yeast, some basil. Med body and moderately fizzy. Sweet, syrupy, noticeable alcohol. Alcohol covers a lot of the basil. I like this better than the normal thing.
